channel.title: "Dumping" Jar
channel.description: Okay, So I've modified a few classes inside the JAR. Now how do I "Dump" all of it to "save" it. Do I individually "dump" each class (if so then where?) or is there a way to "dump" the JAR file?

item.title: "Dumping" Jar
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Did you read the post?

Read full topic

item.title: "Dumping" Jar
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:5, topic:345023”][quote author=the bank link=topic=441397.msg3250383#msg3250383 date=1277699548]

[quote author=CoonHunter link=topic=441397.msg3250350#msg3250350 date=1277696344]
Winrar will actually open a jar file and unpack it. I have not found a jar it won’t do, but that’s not saying its going to unpack any jar.
[/quote]Stop.
[/quote]Yeah, that was pretty lulz, I mean, besides the fact that it was totally the opposite of what was asked.[/quote]
Everybody that has asked me about dumping, is normally talking about unpacking. So that’s what I assumed, sorry if I mis-understood.

Read full topic
